canonical_explanation.text: Air is a mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth. It is mostly nitrogen and oxygen, with small amounts of carbon dioxide and water vapor. Air occupies space, has weight, and can be compressed. Wind is moving air. Air pollution from vehicles and factories harms our health and environment. We must keep air clean by planting trees and reducing pollution.
rules: Air is made of gases: mostly nitrogen and oxygen
Air occupies space and has weight
Air pollution is caused by smoke from vehicles and factories
Planting trees and reducing smoke helps keep air clean

questions.question_text: Air is a mixture of:
questions.explanation_correct: Air is a mixture of different gases like nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor. Gases are not solids or liquids, so the correct answer is C) Gases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is not a mixture of solids, liquids, or metals. It is a mixture of different gases that surround the Earth. Gases like nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor make up the air we breathe.

questions.question_text: Which gas is found most in air?
questions.explanation_correct: The gas found most in air is nitrogen. Nitrogen makes up about 78% of the air around us. This is the highest percentage of any gas in the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is nitrogen because it is the gas that takes up the most space in the air. Oxygen is the second most common gas in the air, making up about 21%. Carbon dioxide and hydrogen are only found in very small amounts in the air.

questions.question_text: Which gas do we need to breathe?
questions.explanation_correct: We need to breathe oxygen to live. Oxygen is the gas that our bodies use to function properly. It is one of the main gases in the air we breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nitrogen, carbon dioxide, and hydrogen are not the gases that our bodies need to breathe. Oxygen is the gas that we must breathe to stay healthy and alive. Our bodies use oxygen to give us energy and keep us going.

questions.question_text: Which gas do plants use to make food?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants use carbon dioxide to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. This is the correct answer because carbon dioxide is one of the main ingredients that plants need to produce their food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oxygen, nitrogen, and water vapor are not the main gases that plants use to make their food. Plants need carbon dioxide, along with sunlight and water, to produce their own food through photosynthesis. This is why carbon dioxide is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Water vapor in air makes the air feel:
questions.explanation_correct: The air feels humid (moist) when it has a lot of water vapor in it. Water vapor is a gas that makes the air feel damp or moist.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The air does not feel dry, cold, or hot when there is a lot of water vapor in it. Water vapor makes the air feel humid or moist, not dry, cold, or hot. Humid air has more water particles in it, which makes the air feel damp and moist.

questions.question_text: Air occupies:
questions.explanation_correct: Air occupies space because it is a mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth. Even though we can't see air, it takes up space and has weight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air does not occupy no space, only underground space, or only water. Air is a mixture of gases that fills the space around us. It takes up space and has weight, which is why the correct answer is that air occupies space.

questions.question_text: When you blow air into a balloon, it gets bigger because:
questions.explanation_correct: When you blow air into a balloon, it gets bigger because air takes up space. The air you blow into the balloon fills up the inside of the balloon, making it expand and get bigger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. The balloon does not get bigger because the balloon is hungry or because air has no weight. The balloon also does not create air - it is just filled with the air that you blow into it.

questions.question_text: Does air have weight?
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, air has weight. Air is made up of tiny particles called molecules that have weight. Even though air is invisible, it takes up space and has mass, which is what we call weight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that air has weight. Even though air is invisible, it is made up of tiny particles called molecules that have weight. Air takes up space and has mass, which is what we call weight. Options A, C, and D are incorrect because all air, whether hot or cold, has weight.

questions.question_text: A filled football is heavier than an empty one because:
questions.explanation_correct: The air inside the filled football has weight, making the whole football heavier than an empty one. Air is a mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth and has weight, so a football filled with air will be heavier than one without air inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The football does not become bigger or change material when it is filled with air. The football just looks heavier because the air inside it has weight, which adds to the overall weight of the football.

questions.question_text: Air can be compressed. This means air can be:
questions.explanation_correct: Air can be compressed, which means it can be squeezed into a smaller space. This is because air is made up of tiny particles that can be pushed closer together when pressure is applied.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air cannot be made hotter or colder just by compressing it. Compressing air does not change its temperature. Air also cannot be changed into water through compression. Compression only reduces the space that the air particles take up, without changing their chemical composition.

questions.question_text: A bicycle pump works because:

options.text: Air can be compressed and pushed

questions.explanation_correct: A bicycle pump works because air can be compressed and pushed. When you push the pump, the air inside is compressed and then released, which makes the air come out at high speed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because air cannot turn into water, it does not disappear, and it is not a solid. Air is a mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth, and it can be compressed and pushed, which is why a bicycle pump works.

questions.question_text: Moving air is called:
questions.explanation_correct: Moving air is called wind. Wind is the movement of air across the Earth's surface, caused by differences in air pressure and temperature. This moving air is what we feel when the wind blows.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because they do not describe moving air. Rain is falling water droplets, clouds are collections of water droplets in the sky, and a storm is a period of strong wind, rain, and sometimes lightning. Only wind refers to moving air.

questions.question_text: Wind helps in:
questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps in drying clothes because it blows air over the wet clothes, which helps the water evaporate faster. The moving air carries away the moisture, making the clothes dry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind does not help in making water, making food, or creating rocks. Water is made through a process called the water cycle, food is made through photosynthesis, and rocks are formed over a very long time from minerals in the Earth's crust. Wind is simply moving air that can help dry things like clothes.

questions.question_text: Windmills use wind to:
questions.explanation_correct: Windmills use the power of wind to generate electricity. The spinning blades of the windmill turn a generator inside, which converts the wind's energy into electrical energy that we can use in our homes and schools.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Windmills do not create water or make clouds. They also do not stop storms. Windmills are designed to capture the energy of the wind and use it to generate electricity, which is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What helps a kite fly?
questions.explanation_correct: Wind helps a kite fly because it provides the force that lifts the kite up and keeps it in the air. As the wind blows, it pushes against the kite, creating a lift that allows the kite to stay up in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, sunlight, and rain do not help a kite fly. Kites need wind to fly because the wind provides the force and lift that keeps the kite up in the air. Without wind, a kite would not be able to stay in the sky and would just fall down to the ground.

questions.question_text: What causes air pollution?
questions.explanation_correct: Smoke from vehicles and factories causes air pollution. These things release harmful gases and particles into the air, making it dirty and unhealthy to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees and fresh air do not cause air pollution. Air pollution is caused by smoke and fumes from things like cars, trucks, and factories. This smoke contains harmful gases and particles that make the air dirty and bad for our health.

questions.question_text: Air pollution can cause:
questions.explanation_correct: Air pollution can cause breathing problems and diseases like asthma or lung infections. This is because air pollution has harmful gases and particles that can make it hard to breathe and make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air pollution does not cause better health or cleaner air. In fact, air pollution is very harmful and can make the air dirty and unsafe to breathe. It is important to reduce air pollution by planting trees and using less fuel in vehicles and factories, so we can have cleaner and healthier air to breathe.

questions.question_text: Which of these pollutes the air?
questions.explanation_correct: Vehicle smoke pollutes the air because it releases harmful gases and particles into the air. These pollutants can make the air dirty and harmful for people to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees and flowers do not pollute the air. They actually help clean the air by releasing oxygen. Rain also does not pollute the air - it can help clean the air by washing away some pollutants. Only vehicle smoke from cars, trucks, and factories releases harmful substances that make the air dirty and polluted.

questions.question_text: Burning garbage releases:
questions.explanation_correct: Burning garbage releases harmful smoke that pollutes the air. This smoke contains chemicals and particles that can make the air dirty and unhealthy to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Burning garbage does not release fresh air or clean water. It releases smoke and chemicals that make the air dirty and bad for our health. Trees and plants help to keep the air clean, not burning garbage.

questions.question_text: Trees help keep air clean because they:

options.text: Give oxygen and absorb carbon dioxide

questions.explanation_correct: Trees help keep air clean because they take in carbon dioxide and release oxygen through a process called photosynthesis. This helps remove the carbon dioxide from the air and replaces it with clean, fresh oxygen that we can breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees do not release smoke or create pollution. Instead, they absorb carbon dioxide, a harmful gas, and release oxygen, which is the gas that we need to breathe. This helps keep the air clean and fresh for us to breathe.

questions.question_text: To reduce air pollution, we should:

options.text: Walk, cycle, or use public transport

questions.explanation_correct: We should walk, cycle, or use public transport instead of using more vehicles. This helps reduce air pollution because vehicles release harmful gases into the air. Walking, cycling, and using public transport do not produce these harmful gases, so they help keep the air clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using more vehicles and burning more garbage will actually increase air pollution. Cutting down trees is also bad because trees help clean the air by absorbing harmful gases. To reduce air pollution, we should choose cleaner ways of transportation like walking, cycling, or using public transport.

questions.question_text: Planting more trees helps to:
questions.explanation_correct: Planting more trees helps to clean the air because trees take in the bad gas called carbon dioxide and release the good gas called oxygen. This helps to make the air cleaner and fresher for us to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Planting more trees does not increase pollution or block sunlight completely. Trees actually help to clean the air by removing bad gases and releasing good oxygen. Trees also do not stop rain, but instead help the water cycle by releasing water vapor into the air.

questions.question_text: About how much of the air is nitrogen?
questions.explanation_correct: About 78% of the air we breathe is nitrogen. This is the largest part of the air around us, so the correct answer is C.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The air we breathe is made up of mainly nitrogen, oxygen, and small amounts of other gases. Nitrogen is the largest part, making up about 78% of the air. So the correct answer is C, not A, B, or D.

questions.question_text: About how much of the air is oxygen?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is that about 21% of the air is oxygen. This is because air is mostly made up of nitrogen (78%) and oxygen (21%), with smaller amounts of other gases like carbon dioxide and water vapor.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that about 21% of the air is oxygen. The other options are incorrect because air is not 78% oxygen, 1% oxygen, or 50% oxygen. Oxygen makes up a smaller part of the air compared to nitrogen, which is the most common gas in the air.

questions.question_text: Sailing boats move because of:
questions.explanation_correct: Sailing boats move because of the wind pushing the sails. The wind blowing across the sails creates a difference in air pressure, which pushes the boat forward.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sailing boats do not move because of an engine, the sun, or the moon. They move because the wind blows against the sails, creating a force that pushes the boat forward. The sails catch the wind and use it to power the boat's movement.

questions.question_text: Firecrackers during festivals cause:
questions.explanation_correct: Firecrackers during festivals cause air pollution and noise pollution. They release harmful chemicals and loud sounds that are not good for our health and the environment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Firecrackers do not cause clean air. In fact, they release lots of smoke and gases that make the air dirty. This air pollution is not good for us or the plants and animals around us. We should try to have celebrations without firecrackers to keep the air clean.

questions.question_text: When you drink through a straw, you use:
questions.explanation_correct: When you drink through a straw, you use air pressure. The air inside your mouth has less pressure than the air outside the straw, so the higher air pressure outside pushes the liquid up the straw and into your mouth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is air pressure, not gravity, electricity, or magnetism. Gravity pulls things down, but when you drink through a straw, the liquid moves up the straw. Electricity and magnetism have nothing to do with drinking through a straw. Air pressure is the key thing that makes the liquid move up the straw and into your mouth.

questions.question_text: Using clean energy like solar and wind helps to:
questions.explanation_correct: Using clean energy like solar and wind helps to reduce air pollution because these sources of energy do not release harmful gases or smoke into the air. They are much better for the environment compared to fossil fuels like coal and oil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using clean energy like solar and wind does not increase pollution or create more smoke. These sources of energy are very clean and do not release any harmful substances into the air. They help to reduce air pollution and are much better for our health and the environment compared to energy sources that use fossil fuels.

questions.question_text: Dust from construction sites causes:
questions.explanation_correct: Dust from construction sites causes air pollution. The dust particles in the air can make it harder for us to breathe, which is bad for our health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dust from construction sites does not create fresh air or more oxygen. It also does not help plant growth. Instead, the dust particles make the air dirty and polluted, which can be harmful to our lungs and the environment.

questions.question_text: We cannot see air because:
questions.explanation_correct: Air is colorless and transparent, which means we cannot see it. It is all around us, but it is not visible to our eyes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air does not hide from us, nor is it too far away or only appears at night. Air is made up of different gases, and these gases are colorless and transparent, which is why we cannot see air.

questions.question_text: Air is made of gases.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is true because air is a mixture of different gases like nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor that surround the Earth. These gases make up the air we breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not false because air is definitely made up of different gases. It's not just one single gas, but a mixture of many different gases like nitrogen, oxygen, and others. If air was just one gas, it wouldn't be able to support life on Earth.

questions.question_text: Oxygen is the most common gas in air.
questions.explanation_correct: The most common gas in air is actually nitrogen, not oxygen. Air is made up of about 78% nitrogen and only 21% oxygen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Many people think oxygen is the most common gas in air because we need oxygen to breathe. However, nitrogen is actually the most abundant gas, making up 78% of the air around us. Oxygen is the second most common gas at 21%. The remaining 1% is made up of other gases like carbon dioxide and water vapor.

questions.question_text: We need oxygen to breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the statement is true. We need oxygen from the air to breathe and live. Oxygen is one of the main gases in the air, and our bodies need it to function properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true because we cannot live without oxygen. Our bodies need oxygen from the air to work. Without oxygen, we would not be able to breathe and would quickly become very sick or even die. Oxygen is a crucial part of the air that surrounds us.

questions.question_text: Air takes up space.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, air takes up space. Air is a mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth. Even though we can't see air, it takes up space around us and fills up any container or room.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, air does not take up space. This is not correct because air is a real substance that fills the space around us. Air is made up of different gases like oxygen and nitrogen, and it takes up space just like other things we can see, like water or a ball.

questions.question_text: Air has no weight.
questions.explanation_correct: Air has weight because it is made up of molecules. Even though air is invisible, it still has mass and takes up space, so it has weight. That's why we can feel the wind blowing - the moving air has weight that pushes against us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people might think air has no weight because we can't see or feel it. But air is actually made up of tiny molecules that have mass, so it does have weight. Even though air feels light, it's still pulled down by gravity like other things on Earth.

questions.question_text: Air can be compressed.
questions.explanation_correct: Air can be compressed because it is a mixture of gases. The gases in air can be squeezed into a smaller space, making the air take up less room. This shows that air has weight and takes up space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people might think air cannot be compressed because it is so light and airy. But air is actually a mixture of different gases, like nitrogen and oxygen. These gases can be squeezed and pushed into a smaller space, which means air can be compressed or made to take up less room.

questions.question_text: Wind is moving air.
questions.explanation_correct: Wind is moving air. When air moves, it creates wind. The air around us is always moving, and this moving air is called wind.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind is not just sitting still air. Wind is air that is moving and flowing. If the air is not moving, it is not wind. Wind is caused by differences in air pressure, which makes the air start moving.

questions.question_text: Smoke from vehicles pollutes the air.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, smoke from vehicles does pollute the air. Vehicles like cars and trucks burn fuels like gasoline or diesel, which releases harmful gases and particles into the air. This makes the air dirty and can be bad for our health and the environment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, smoke from vehicles does not pollute the air. Vehicles do not release any smoke or gases that can pollute the air. The air around us is always clean and pure. Smoke and air pollution only come from factories, not from vehicles.

questions.question_text: Cutting trees helps clean the air.
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting trees does not help clean the air. Trees actually help clean the air by producing oxygen and removing harmful gases like carbon dioxide. Cutting down trees makes the air more polluted.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Many people think that cutting down trees helps clean the air, but this is not true. Trees actually help clean the air by producing oxygen and removing harmful gases like carbon dioxide. When we cut down trees, there are less trees to do this important job, so the air becomes more polluted. We need to plant more trees to keep the air clean and healthy.

questions.question_text: Air pollution can cause breathing problems.
questions.explanation_correct: Air pollution can cause breathing problems because the harmful gases and particles in the air can make it hard for us to breathe properly. Breathing in polluted air can make our lungs sick and cause coughing, wheezing, and other breathing difficulties.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air pollution does not cause breathing problems. The air we breathe is always clean and healthy. However, this is not true. Air pollution from vehicles, factories, and other sources can actually make the air dirty and unhealthy to breathe. Breathing in polluted air can make it hard for us to breathe properly and cause problems like coughing and wheezing.

questions.question_text: Air is a mixture of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Air is a mixture of different gases, like nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor. That's why the correct answer is 'gases'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'gases'. Air is not a single gas, but a mixture of many different gases. It's not a solid or a liquid, but a gas that surrounds the Earth. So the right answer is 'gases', not anything else.

questions.question_text: The gas we need to breathe is _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The gas we need to breathe is oxygen. Oxygen is the most important gas in the air that helps us breathe and stay alive. Our bodies need oxygen to function properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is oxygen. Oxygen is the gas that our bodies need to breathe and live. We cannot survive without oxygen. The other gases in the air, like nitrogen and carbon dioxide, are not the ones we need to breathe.

questions.question_text: _____ is the most common gas in air.
questions.explanation_correct: The most common gas in air is nitrogen. Nitrogen makes up about 78% of the air we breathe. It is the largest part of the mixture of gases that makes up the air around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'Nitrogen'. The air we breathe is mostly made up of nitrogen gas, which is the most common gas in the atmosphere. The other main gases in air are oxygen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor, but nitrogen is the largest part of the air mixture.

questions.question_text: Plants use _____ gas from air to make food.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants use carbon dioxide gas from the air to make their own food, a process called photosynthesis. The carbon from carbon dioxide is used by plants to grow and produce their food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'carbon dioxide'. Plants need carbon dioxide from the air to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. They cannot use other gases like oxygen or nitrogen from the air to make their food.

questions.question_text: Air occupies _____ and has weight.
questions.explanation_correct: Air takes up space even though we cannot see it. You can prove this by turning a glass upside down in water â€” the air inside stops water from entering.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Even though air is invisible, it occupies space. Try pushing an upside-down cup into water to see how air takes up space inside it.

questions.question_text: Air can be _____ or squeezed into smaller space.
questions.explanation_correct: Air can be compressed because it is made up of tiny particles called molecules that can be pushed closer together. When we compress air, the air molecules get closer, taking up less space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'compressed'. Air is made up of tiny particles called molecules that can be pushed closer together. When we compress air, the air molecules get closer, taking up less space. However, air cannot be 'expanded' or 'squeezed'. That would not be correct because air can only be compressed, not expanded or squeezed into a smaller space.

questions.question_text: Moving air is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Moving air is called wind. Air is all around us and can move, and when air moves, it is called wind.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'wind'. Wind is the name we use for moving air. Air is the mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth, and when this air starts to move, we call it wind. The question was asking for the name of moving air, and the answer 'wind' is correct.

questions.question_text: _____ use wind to generate electricity.
questions.explanation_correct: Windmills use wind to spin their blades and generate electricity. The wind blows on the windmill blades, causing them to rotate and turn a generator inside the windmill, which then produces electricity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 'Windmills'. Windmills are machines that use the power of the wind to generate electricity. They have large blades that spin when the wind blows, and this spinning motion turns a generator inside the windmill to produce electricity. Other things like cars or factories cannot generate electricity from the wind.

questions.question_text: Smoke from vehicles causes air _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is 'pollution' because smoke from vehicles, factories, and other sources releases harmful substances into the air, making it dirty and unhealthy for us to breathe. This is called air pollution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'pollution'. Smoke from vehicles contains harmful substances that make the air dirty and unhealthy to breathe. This is called air pollution. The blank should be filled with the word 'pollution' to correctly answer the question.

questions.question_text: Planting _____ helps keep the air clean.
questions.explanation_correct: Planting trees helps keep the air clean because trees take in carbon dioxide and release oxygen. This helps remove pollution from the air and make it cleaner for us to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer should be 'trees'. Trees are important because they absorb harmful gases like carbon dioxide and release oxygen, which makes the air cleaner. Planting more trees is one of the best ways to reduce air pollution and keep the air clean and healthy for us.

questions.question_text: Air pollution can cause _____ problems.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'breathing' because air pollution can make it harder for us to breathe properly. Polluted air contains harmful chemicals and particles that can get into our lungs and make it difficult to take in clean air, which our body needs to stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'breathing'. Air pollution does not cause physical or mental health problems directly. However, it can make it harder for us to breathe properly. Polluted air contains harmful chemicals and particles that can get into our lungs and make it difficult to take in clean air, which our body needs to stay healthy.

questions.question_text: Using _____ energy like solar power helps reduce pollution.
questions.explanation_correct: Using clean energy like solar power helps reduce pollution because it does not produce harmful gases that make the air dirty. Solar power comes from the sun, which is a clean and renewable source of energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer should be 'clean'. Using clean energy like solar power is better for the environment because it does not release polluting gases into the air. The question is asking for a word that describes the type of energy, and 'clean' is the correct answer because it refers to energy sources that do not produce air pollution.

questions.question_text: Arrange gases in air from most to least amount.
questions.explanation_correct: Nitrogen takes up the most amount of space in air, followed by oxygen, and then carbon dioxide which is present in very small amounts. This is because nitrogen makes up about 78% of air, oxygen makes up about 21%, and carbon dioxide is only about 0.04% of air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The gases in air are not equally distributed. Nitrogen is the most abundant, making up about 78% of air. Oxygen is the next most common, making up about 21% of air. Carbon dioxide is only present in very small amounts, around 0.04% of air. So the correct order from most to least is nitrogen, oxygen, and then carbon dioxide.

questions.question_text: Arrange from least polluting to most polluting.
questions.explanation_correct: Walking is the least polluting because it doesn't use any vehicles that produce air pollution. Riding a bicycle also doesn't produce much pollution. Driving a car is the most polluting because it burns fuel and releases harmful gases into the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order from least polluting to most polluting is: Walking, Riding a bicycle, Driving a car. This is because walking and riding a bicycle do not use any fuel or produce air pollution, while driving a car burns fuel and releases harmful gases into the air, which is the most polluting.

questions.question_text: Arrange actions to reduce pollution from easiest to hardest.
ordering_items: Turn off lights when not needed
correct_answer: Turn off lights when not needed
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from easiest to hardest is turning off lights when not needed, planting a tree, and buying an electric car. Turning off lights is the easiest thing we can do to reduce pollution, because it uses less electricity and energy. Planting a tree is also easy and helps clean the air. Buying an electric car is the hardest, because it's more expensive than the other actions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be buying an electric car, planting a tree, and turning off lights when not needed. Buying an electric car is the hardest because it costs a lot of money. Planting a tree is easier than buying an electric car, but still takes more effort than just turning off lights. Turning off lights when not needed is the easiest way to reduce pollution, because it's a simple action we can do every day.

questions.question_text: Arrange from no wind to strong wind.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from no wind to strong wind is Calm (no wind), Breeze (gentle wind), Storm (very strong wind). This is because Calm means there is no wind at all, Breeze is a gentle wind, and Storm is a very strong, powerful wind.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Breeze (gentle wind), Calm (no wind), Storm (very strong wind). This is not correct because Calm, which means no wind at all, should come before Breeze, which is a gentle wind. The order should go from the least amount of wind (Calm) to the strongest wind (Storm).

questions.question_text: Arrange steps of using a bicycle pump.
questions.explanation_correct: To pump air into a tyre: first connect the pump, then pull the handle up to draw air in, push it down to force air out, and the air goes into the tyre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Think about the steps in order â€” you must connect the pump first, then the pulling and pushing motion moves air from outside into the tyre.
